p: The current research work is an exclusive study for finding phytochemical composition, radical scavenging, anti-inflammatory and anti-acetylcholinesterase activity of methanolic extracts of B. vulgaris roots and leaves part. The results of AChE inhibition and radical scavenging assays were highly significant. Research data indicate that B. vulgaris is greatly enriched with antioxidants which can be implemented as potential therapeutic agents for the treatment of various neurological disorders. In the light of above mentioned pharmacognostic activity of B. vulgaris extracts, further studies on bioassay guided separation of bioactive compounds and their mechanism of action is recommended.
